title.value: List-GRAND: A Practical Way to Achieve Maximum Likelihood Decoding
title.justification: This title directly captures the major contribution and subject of the research.
title.quote: List-GRAND: A Practical Way to Achieve Maximum Likelihood Decoding

extractions.description: The paper proposes List-GRAND (LGRAND), a technique for enhancing the decoding performance of Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND) to match Maximum Likelihood (ML) decoding performance like Soft-GRAND (SGRAND). The authors evaluate LGRAND's performance through numerical simulations and implementation results, demonstrating its viability for high-throughput parallel hardware implementations.

type.justification: The paper includes numerical simulation results and VLSI hardware implementation details to validate the proposed LGRAND technique.
type.quote: Numerical simulation results show that LGRAND enhances ORBGRAND’s decoding performance by 0.5-0.75 dB for channel-codes of various classes at a target FER of 10^-7.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on decoding techniques for error-correcting codes using the GRAND framework.
name.quote: Guessing Random Additive Noise Decoding (GRAND) is a recently proposed universal Maximum Likelihood (ML) decoder for short-length and high-rate linear block-codes.

name.justification: The paper provides details on a VLSI implementation of the proposed decoding technique.
name.quote: In comparison to ORBGRAND’s VLSI implementation, the proposed LGRAND hardware has a 4.84% area overhead.

name.justification: The paper discusses applications of the proposed technique in 5G communication systems.
name.quote: RLLC (Ultra Reliable Low Latency Communication) is considered an important use case of 5G and future communication networks.

name.justification: The main model proposed in the paper is List-GRAND (LGRAND).
name.quote: In this paper, we propose List-GRAND (LGRAND), a technique for enhancing the decoding performance of ORBGRAND to match the ML decoding performance of SGRAND.

is_contributed.justification: List-GRAND is the primary contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose List-GRAND (LGRAND), a technique for enhancing the decoding performance...

is_executed.justification: The implementation details and VLSI architecture of LGRAND are discussed.
is_executed.quote: The proposed LGRAND VLSI implementation can achieve an average information throughput of 47.27 − 51.36 Gbps.

is_compared.justification: LGRAND's performance is compared with other GRAND variants such as ORBGRAND and SGRAND.
is_compared.quote: Numerical simulation results show that LGRAND enhances ORBGRAND’s decoding performance...

referenced_paper_title.justification: List-GRAND is introduced in this paper, hence no reference to previous works is available.

name.justification: ORBGRAND is one of the baseline models with which LGRAND is compared.
name.quote: Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND) is another soft-input GRAND variant...

is_contributed.justification: ORBGRAND is used as a reference for comparison in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND) is another soft-input GRAND variant...

is_executed.justification: ORBGRAND's implementation details and performance comparisons are given.
is_executed.quote: In [18], a VLSI architecture for ORBGRAND for n = 128 is presented...

is_compared.justification: ORBGRAND’s performance is directly compared to LGRAND and other variants.
is_compared.quote: Furthermore, the proposed LGRAND is compared with ORBGRAND-ILWO. At the target FER of 10^-7, as shown in Fig. 14 and Fig. 15, the proposed LGRAND performs better than the ORBGRAND-ILWO.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference paper for ORBGRAND.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ordered Reliability Bits GRAND (ORBGRAND) [9] is another soft-input GRAND variant...

name.justification: SGRAND is compared with LGRAND in terms of decoding performance.
name.quote: Soft-GRAND (SGRAND) is a prominent soft-input GRAND variant, outperforming the other GRAND variants in decoding performance...

is_contributed.quote: Soft-GRAND (SGRAND) is a prominent soft-input GRAND variant...

is_executed.justification: SGRAND’s implementation details are not discussed in this paper.
is_executed.quote: relative details about VLSI implementation are not provided for SGRAND.

is_compared.justification: SGRAND’s performance is directly compared to LGRAND and other variants.
is_compared.quote: SGRAND, the state of the art ML decoding performance variant is compared to LGRAND.

referenced_paper_title.value: Soft Maximum Likelihood Decoding using GRAND
referenced_paper_title.justification: SGRAND's reference paper is cited for comparison purposes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Soft GRAND (SGRAND) [10], soft-input variant that outperforms other GRAND variants in terms of decoding performance.
